question:
Default print range in Excel 365 when printing worksheet?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• By default, when you choose Print (Ctrl + P) in Excel 365, the Active Sheet is set as the print range.
  • This means only the currently selected worksheet will be sent to the printer.
  • You don’t need to manually select the entire sheet; Excel automatically includes all used cells on that sheet.

Additional Information:

  • Selected Range prints only the cells you have selected, if you change the dropdown.
  • All Sheets will print every worksheet tab in the workbook.
  • Entire Workbook prints all sheets in their entirety, including hidden sheets.

question:
Excel 365 function that removes irregular spacing?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• The TRIM function removes all extra spaces from text, leaving only single spaces between words or values.
  • It also removes any leading and trailing spaces from the text string.
  • Usage example: =TRIM( " Hello World ") returns "Hello World".

Additional Information:

  • AVERAGE calculates the mean of numeric values.
  • SUM adds up a range of numbers.
  • VLOOKUP searches for a value in the first column of a range and returns a corresponding value from another column.

question:
Shortcut to insert a new row in Excel 365?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Ctrl + Shift + + triggers the Insert dialog in Excel when a row (or cell) is selected, and defaults to inserting an entire row if the active cell is within a row selection.
  • It provides a quick, ribbonfree method to insert rows without using the mouse.
  • This shortcut works in any worksheet and respects your current selection (row vs. column).

Additional Information:

  • If you want to insert a column , you first select a column and then use the same shortcut.
  • Ctrl + Alt + + is not a standard Excel shortcut.
  • You can also rightclick a row number and choose Insert from the context menu.

question:
Tool used to create or edit formulas in Microsoft Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In Microsoft Excel365, the Formula bar is used for creating or editing formulas in a worksheet.
  • It displays the active cell’s contents and allows you to enter or modify formulas easily.
  • While you can edit directly in a cell, the Formula bar provides clarity and access to the full formula.

Additional Information:

  • The Formula bar includes the Name Box on the left and the fx button for inserting functions.
  • The Auditing toolbar (Formula Auditing) contains tools like Trace Precedents and Evaluate Formula , not for direct entry.
  • Precedents refer to cells that feed into a formula; it’s not a standalone editing tool.
  • The Watch window monitors selected cells’ values and formulas across worksheets.

question:
Correct statement about autofit row height in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Single-clicking on the boundary between row headers will automatically adjust the row height to fit the content.
option_2: Double-clicking on the boundary between column headers will automatically adjust the column height to fit the content.
option_3: Single-clicking on the boundary between column headers will automatically adjust the column height to fit the content.
option_4: Double-clicking on the boundary between row headers will automatically adjust the row height to fit the content.
solution:
• Doubleclicking on the boundary between row headers will automatically adjust the row height to fit the content.
  • This action activates Excel’s AutoFit Row Height feature for that row.
  • Singleclicking or interacting with column boundaries affects column width, not row height.

Additional Information:

  • You can also select one or more rows and choose Home tab→ Format → AutoFit Row Height .
  • If multiple rows are selected, doubleclicking any selected row’s boundary auto fits all selected rows.
  • AutoFit considers wrapped text and the tallest cell content when adjusting height.

question:
Function used to concatenate text in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• In Excel365, the CONCATENATE function is used to join or combine text strings from different cells.
  • You write formulas like =CONCATENATE(A1,B 1) or include separators: = CONCATENATE( A1," ",B 1).
  • Though still available for compatibility, CONCATENATE has been supplemented by newer functions such as CONCAT and TEXTJOIN .

Additional Information:

  • JOIN and MERGE are not Excel functions for concatenation; MERGE merges cells, and JOIN isn’t a builtin function.
  • ADD performs numeric addition, not text joining.
  • The CONCAT function accepts ranges (e.g., =CONCAT( A1:C1)), and TEXTJOIN allows a delimiter and ignoring empty cells (e.g., =TEXTJOIN( " ",TRUE ,A1:A3)).

question:
Function to count empty cells in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• The COUNTBLANK() function returns the number of empty cells in a given range.
  • For example, =COUNTBLANK( A1:A10) will count all blank cells between A1 and A10.
  • Other functions: COUNT() counts numeric entries, COUNTA() counts non-empty cells, and COUNTB() is not a valid Excel function.

Additional Information:

  • COUNTA() includes text, numbers, and errors—anything not blank.
  • COUNT() strictly tallies cells containing numbers.
  • COUNTBLANK() is particularly useful for data validation and identifying missing entries.
  • There is no built-in COUNTB() function in Excel.

question:
Formula to create absolute cell reference in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• To create an absolute reference to cell B2, use $B$2 .
  • The dollar signs before both column letter and row number lock them when copying the formula.
  • B$2 locks only the row, $B2 locks only the column, and B2 is a fully relative reference.

Additional Information:

  • Absolute references ensure that the referenced cell remains constant, regardless of where the formula is moved or copied.
  • In Edit mode, pressing F4 cycles through reference types: $B$2→ B$2 → $B2 → B2.
  • Commonly used when you need to refer repeatedly to a fixed cell (e.g., a tax rate or lookup value) in multiple formulas.

question:
How to start writing a formula in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Formulas in Excel 365 always begin with “=”.
  • Typing “=” in a cell or the formula bar tells Excel you’re entering a formula.
  • After “=”, you can enter cell references, functions, operators, etc.

Additional Information:

  • If you start with “+” or “-”, Excel treats it as an arithmetic sign, but “=” is required torecognise a full formula.
  • Pressing F2 lets you edit an existing formula in-cell, and you’ll see the “=” at the start.
  • Older spreadsheets (e.g., Lotus 1-2-3) used different prefixes (like “@”), but Excelstandardised on “=”.

question:
Cell address calculation in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Starting from D7 , moving two columns to the right takes you to F7 .
  • From F7 , moving three rows down lands you at F10 .
  • Therefore, the correct address is F10 .

Additional Information:

  • Columns in Excel are labeled A, B, C, …; D is the 4th column, so 4 + 2 = 6→ F.
  • Rows are numbered sequentially, so 7 + 3 = 10.
  • You can navigate using the Name Box (top left) by typing the cell address directly.

question:
Option in MS Excel 365 to sort data by multiple columns

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Custom Sort allows you to sort data based on multiple columns simultaneously.
  • Open it via Data > Sort and then click on Custom Sort .

Additional Information:

  • In the Custom Sort dialog, use Add Level to include more columns and set the sort order for each.
  • Quick Sort , AutoFilter , and Sort A to Z only work on a single column or provide filtering, not multi-column sorting.

question:
How to delete a row/column in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Right-click on the row or column and choose ‘Delete’ from the context menu.
option_2: Use the Ctrl+D keyboard shortcut.
option_3: Use the Ctrl+H keyboard shortcut.
option_4: Go to the ‘Insert’ tab on the Excel ribbon and click on ‘Delete’.
solution:
• Right-click the row or column header and select Delete from the context menu to remove it immediately.
  • Use the keyboard shortcut Ctrl + - to delete the selected row or column quickly.
  • Remaining cells shift automatically to fill the space after deletion.

Additional Information:

  • To delete multiple rows or columns at once, select all desired headers before applying the delete action.
  • In the Home > Delete group on the ribbon, you can choose Delete Sheet Rows or Delete Sheet Columns .
  • Press Ctrl + Z to undo a deletion if done by mistake.

question:
Cell reference type that updates on copy-paste in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Relative cell reference adjusts automatically based on the formula’s new location when copied and pasted.
  • Written without dollar signs (e.g., A1), allowing both row and column to shift.
  • Ideal for formulas that need to work across multiple rows or columns dynamically.

Additional Information:

  • Absolute cell reference (e.g., $A$1) remains fixed regardless of where it’s copied.
  • Mixed cell reference (e.g., A$1 or $A1) locks either the row or the column only.
  • Circular cell reference occurs when a formula refers back to its own cell, causing an error unless iterative calculation is enabled.

question:
NOT a method to open a spreadsheet in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Shift + Ctrl + N is not assigned to opening a spreadsheet in Excel; it doesn’t trigger any “Open” dialog.
  • Ctrl + N opens a new blank workbook (new spreadsheet).
  • Both Alt + F + O and the File -> Open commandopen existing spreadsheets.

Additional Information:

  • You can also press Ctrl + O as a direct shortcut to open the “Open” dialog.
  • Shift + Ctrl + N in Windows Explorer creates a new folder, not relevant in Excel.
  • Double-clicking an .xlsx file in File Explorer will launch Excel and open that file.

question:
Sequence to delete a column in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Select the cell<<Left click<<Delete<<Entire Row
option_2: Select the cell<<Right click<<Delete<<Entire Row
option_3: Select the cell<<Left click<<Delete<<Entire Column
option_4: Select the cell<<Right click<<Delete<<Entire Column
solution:
• The correct sequence is to select the cell in the target column, right-click, choose Delete , and then select Entire Column .
  • This removes the entire column containing the selected cell.
  • Remaining columns shift left automatically to fill the gap.

Additional Information:

  • You can also delete a column via Home > Delete > Delete Sheet Columns on the Ribbon.
  • After selecting the column header, press Ctrl + – (Ctrl + Minus) to delete it quickly.

question:
Statement about deleting rows in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: If you want to delete multiple rows at once, simply select the rows by clicking and dragging over the row numbers, and then press ‘Ctrl’ and ‘−‘.
option_2: If you want to delete multiple rows at once, simply select the rows by clicking and dragging over the row numbers, and then press ‘Ctrl’ and ‘space’.
option_3: If you want to delete multiple rows at once, simply select the rows by clicking and dragging over the row numbers, and then press ‘Ctrl’ and ‘+’.
option_4: If you want to delete multiple rows at once, simply select the rows by clicking and dragging over the row numbers, and then press ‘Ctrl’ and ‘Enter’.
solution:
• Selecting the desired rows (by dragging over the row headers) and pressing Ctrl + - deletes all selected rows instantly.
  • You can select multiple contiguous rows by clicking and dragging over their numbers before using the shortcut.

Additional Information:

  • If you press Ctrl + - on a selected cell rather than a header, the Delete dialog opens—choose Entire Row to confirm.
  • You can also right-click on the selected row headers and choose Delete > Entire Row , then undo with Ctrl + Z if needed.

question:
Cell identification by column and row in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• A3 is the correct format, with the column letter first and the row number second.
  • Cell references in Excel are case-insensitive , so typing a3 works the same.
  • Formats like 3A , AA , or 33 do not follow the letter-then-number pattern and are invalid.

Additional Information:

  • While mixed (e.g., A$3 or $A3) and absolute (e.g., $A$3) references use dollar signs, the base reference always follows letter+number .
  • After column Z comes AA , AB , etc., but the letters still precede the numbers.
  • In formulas, you can reference a cell directly (e.g., =A3*2) to perform calculations.

question:
Text alignment that justifies text in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Justify aligns text to both the left and right sides of the cell, stretching it evenly across the width.
  • It adds extra spacing between words or characters so each line fills the cell margins.
  • You can apply it from Home > Alignment group or via Format Cells > Alignment tab.

Additional Information:

  • For justification to work properly on a single line, ensure Wrap Text is enabled.
  • If the text spans multiple lines, Excel will distribute words across each line to fill the width.
  • Unlike Word, Excel doesn’t have a direct keyboard shortcut for Justify; use the ribbon or Format Cells dialog.

question:
What ‘Save As’ does in MS Excel 365 that ‘Save’ doesn’t

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Save the workbook without confirmation
option_2: Save the workbook without any changes
option_3: Save the workbook with a new name or location
option_4: Save the workbook with the same name
solution:
• Save As allows you to save the workbook with a new name or in a different location , creating a separate file.
  • It opens the Save As dialog box, prompting you to specify the file name, format, and storage path.
  • Unlike the regular Save , it does not overwrite the existing file unless you explicitly choose the same name and location.

Additional Information:

  • You can press F12 as a shortcut to launch the Save As dialog directly.
  • In the Save As dialog, you may also change the file format (for example, to PDF or .xlsx).
  • Using Save As is useful for version control , allowing you to keep older copies intact.

question:
Function to calculate average in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• The AVERAGE function calculates the arithmetic mean of the specified range of numbers.
  • It automatically ignores empty cells and cells containing text.
  • Use it by entering =AVERAGE( A1:A10) (adjust range as needed).

Additional Information:

  • MEDIAN returns the middle value of a dataset, not the overall mean.
  • AVG and MEAN are not valid built-in Excel function names.
  • For weighted averages, combine SUMPRODUCT and SUM functions.

question:
File type that saves as comma-delimited text in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• CSV saves data as a comma-separated values text file, ensuring compatibility across platforms.
  • The resulting file is plain text, making it lightweight and easy to open in any spreadsheet software.
  • It updates cell values but does not preserve formatting, formulas, or multiple sheets.

Additional Information:

  • You can open CSV files in simple text editors (e.g., Notepad) to inspect or edit raw data.
  • When importing, applications may prompt you to specify the delimiter and encoding (e.g., UTF-8).
  • For richer features, use XLSX , but for universal compatibility and data exchange, CSV is preferred.

question:
Steps to edit sales data for May in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Click on the cell containing the May sales data -> Press F6 to enter edit mode -> Make the necessary changes -> Press Enter to confirm the edit
option_2: Click on the cell containing the May sales data -> Press F1 to enter edit mode -> Make the necessary changes -> Press Enter to confirm the edit
option_3: Click on the cell containing the May sales data -> Press F7 to enter edit mode -> Make the necessary changes -> Press Enter to confirm the edit
option_4: Click on the cell containing the May sales data -> Press F2 to enter edit mode -> Make the necessary changes -> Press Enter to confirm the edit
solution:
• Select the May sales cell by clicking on it.
  • Press F2 to enter edit mode in the selected cell.
  • Make the corrections and press Enter to save the changes.

Additional Information:

  • You can also double-click the cell to begin editing directly.
  • Press Esc before Enter to cancel any unwanted edits.
  • Editing in the Formula Bar can be easier for long entries.

question:
Shortcut to open a new spreadsheet in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Ctrl + N opens a new blank workbook in Excel.
  • It performs the same action as File > New from the ribbon.
  • Using Ctrl + N is faster than navigating through menus.

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + O opens the Open dialog for existing files.
  • Alt + O is not a standard shortcut for creating a new workbook.
  • Shift + N has no default function in Excel.

question:
Command to insert a new row above in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Use Insert Row to add a new row immediately above the selected row.
  • This command is available in the Home > Cells > Insert group as Insert Sheet Rows .
  • You can press Ctrl + Shift + + (plus) after selecting a row to insert a new row above it.

Additional Information:

  • You can also right-click the row header and choose Insert to achieve the same result.
  • If you select multiple rows first, Insert Row will add the same number of new rows above the topmost selection.
  • Inserting rows shifts all existing rows below downward to accommodate the new row.

question:
NOT a benefit of creating a table in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Automatic filtering and sorting options
option_3: Increased data integrity and accuracy
option_4: Enhanced visual appeal and formatting
solution:
• Improved calculation capabilities isnot inherently provided by an Excel table; tables primarily organise data rather than add new formula functions.
  • Tables do offer automatic filtering and sorting through their header controls.
  • Using a table improves data integrity (consistent formulas) and visual formatting (built-in styles).

Additional Information:

  • Tables support structured references , making formula writing more intuitive.
  • When you add rows or columns, table ranges auto-expand for calculations and charts.
  • Built-in Table Styles allow quick formatting and banded rows for readability.

question:
Shortcut to save a workbook in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Ctrl + S saves the active workbook, updating the file instantly.
  • If the workbook hasn’t been saved before, Ctrl + S opens the Save As dialog for naming and location.
  • This shortcut works across all Office applications for quick saving.

Additional Information:

  • Using Ctrl + S is faster than navigating to File > Save on the ribbon.
  • If the file is stored on OneDrive , Ctrl + S also syncs changes to the cloud automatically.
  • You can press F12 to launch Save As directly when you need to change the file name or format.

question:
NOT visible option in ‘Filter’ menu in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Filter by selected cell colour
option_2: Filter by selected cell font
option_3: Filter by selected cell height
option_4: Filter by selected cell values
solution:
• The Filter by Selected Cell Height option is not available in the right-click Filter menu.
  • Excel provides Filter by Selected Cell’s Value , Filter by Selected Cell’s Color , and Filter by Selected Cell’s Font Color .
  • Cell height is a layout property, not a data attribute, so filtering by height isn’t supported.

Additional Information:

  • These options appear only when AutoFilter is enabled via Home > Sort & Filter > Filter .
  • If a cell has a fill or font color applied, the Filter by Color and Filter by Font Color entries become visible.
  • For filtering by other criteria (e.g., text length), use the column header’s Text Filters or Number Filters .

question:
Action to reverse recent changes in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Undo reverses the most recent action, whether it’s typing, deleting, or formatting.
  • You can execute it via the Quick Access Toolbar or by pressing Ctrl + Z .
  • It maintains your workflow by allowing multiple consecutiveundos in sequence.

Additional Information:

  • Excel’s Undo stack typically holds the last 100 actions, enabling extensive backtracking.
  • You can click the dropdown arrow next to the Undo icon to select and undo several actions at once.
  • If you go too far, use Redo ( Ctrl + Y ) to reapply undone actions.

question:
Shortcut to edit content of selected cell in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• F2 enters edit mode directly in the selected cell.
  • It places the cursor at the end of the cell’s content, allowing you to modify text without using the formula bar.
  • This shortcut speeds up data correction workflows.

Additional Information:

  • You can also double-click the cell to enter edit mode, unless editing is disabled for that range.
  • Press Enter after editing to confirm changes and move down one cell.
  • To exit without saving changes, press Esc .

question:
Purpose of using chart in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• A chart visually represents data , making patterns, trends, and comparisons immediately clear.
  • It helps convert large datasets into understandable visuals for quicker insights.
  • Charts can be customized with titles, labels, and legends to improve readability.

Additional Information:

  • Excel offers various chart types— Column , Line , Pie , Bar —to suit different analysis needs.
  • Charts automatically update when the underlying data changes, ensuring accuracy.
  • You can insert a chart via Insert > Charts or use Recommended Charts for suggestions.

question:
Shortcut key to save a workbook in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Ctrl+S saves the current workbook, updating the file with all recent changes.
  • If the workbook is new, Ctrl+S opens the Save As dialog to specify name and location.
  • This shortcut works across all Office applications for quick saving.

Additional Information:

  • Excel 365’s AutoSave feature (when connected to OneDrive/SharePoint) automatically saves changes, supplementing Ctrl+S .
  • To change the file name or format, press F12 to launch Save As directly.
  • Regularly using Ctrl+S helps prevent data loss in case of unexpected shutdowns.

question:
Shortcut to print a spreadsheet in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Ctrl + P opens the Print dialog in Excel 365 to print the active spreadsheet.
  • It serves the same function as clicking File > Print or pressing Ctrl + F2 in some setups.
  • After opening, you can choose printer, page range, orientation, and other settings before printing.

Additional Information:

  • You can preview pages in Print Preview within the dialog before confirming.
  • Use Esc to close the Print dialog without printing.
  • In Excel for the web, Ctrl + P opens your browser’s print interface.

question:
Ribbon tab for add rows in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Go to the Home tab and, in the Cells group, click the Insert dropdown.
  • Choose Insert Sheet Rows to add a new row above the selected row.
  • This places the row immediately and shifts existing rows downward.

Additional Information:

  • You can also press Ctrl + Shift + + after selecting a row to insert above.
  • Right-click the row header and select Insert → Entire Row for the same effect.
  • If you select multiple rows, Excel will insert the same number of new rows above.

question:
Symbol to begin a formula in MS Excel 365

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• The = sign tells Excel you are entering a formula.
  • Every formula in Excel 365 must begin with = , otherwise it’s treated as plain text.
  • After the = , you can enter cell references, operators, and functions to calculate values.

Additional Information:

  • In very old Excelversions you could start formulas with + or - , but = is the universal standard now.
  • You can press Shift + F3 to open the Insert Function dialog and build formulas without typing.
  • After typing your formula, press Enter to confirm and calculate the result.

question:
Function in MS Excel 365 to generate random number for statistical use

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• RAND generates a random real number greater than (or equal to) 0 and less than 1.
  • It’s one of the simplest random-number functions, ideal for statistical analysis , simulation , and probability modeling .
  • You invoke it by entering =RAND( ) into a cell, and it recalculates a new value whenever the worksheet changes.

Additional Information:

  • RAND is a volatile function: it recalculates on every worksheet change or recalculation.
  • For multiple random values at once, use RANDARRAY (in newer Excel versions).
  • To generate random integers within a range, combine RAND with functions like RANDBETWEEN or use * INT(RAND()n )+1 .
